00001 /***********************************************
00002 
00003 Author: Julie Betlach
00004 
00005 Adapted from code written by: Terry Caton, tcaton(a)hotmail.com
00006 Project Webpage: http://cajun-jsonapi.sourceforge.net/
00007 
00008 Original code parsed files in json format.
00009 Code now parses files in PDI format for a project for Washington University,
00010 course CSE 533S: Pattern Oriented Software Design and Development, Summer 2009.
00011 
00012 File Name: Elements.h
00013 
00014 File Description: The Elements.h file is a part of the PDI parser.  It provides the implementation
00015 of the different element types: ARRAY_ELEMENT, DISPLAY_ELEMENT, and NULL_ELEMENT.
00016 *************************************************/
00017

00031 enum ElementType
00032 {
00033    ARRAY_ELEMENT,
00034    DISPLAY_ELEMENT,
00035    NULL_ELEMENT

00040 // base class - provides little useful in client code except constructor
00041 
00042 class ElementImp;
00043 
00056 class Element
00057 {
00058 public:
00059    // note: nothing virtual in here! and only one (1) pointer member
00060    Element();
00061    Element(const Element& element);
00062    ~Element();
00063 
00064    Element& operator= (const Element& element);
00065 
00066    ElementType Type() const;
00067 
00068    // const & non-const visitor interfaces
00069    void Accept(Visitor& visitor);
00070    void Accept(ConstVisitor& visitor) const;
00071 
00072    void SetName(const std::string& nameIn);
00073    const std::string& Name() const;
00074 
00075 protected:
00076    Element(ElementImp* elementImp);
00077 
00078    ElementImp& ImpBase();
00079    const ElementImp& ImpBase() const;
00080 
00081 private:
00082    ElementImp* m_pElementImp;
00083 };
00084 
00085 
00087 // template base class for all "concrete" element types. employs "curiously
00088 // recursive template pattern", also provides little interface used in client
00089 // code
00090 
00094 template <typename ElementImpTypeT>
00095 class Element_T : public Element
00096 {
00097 public:
00098    static ElementType Type_i();
00099 
00100 protected:
00101    Element_T();
00102 
00103    //  return type is covariant with ImpBase(), but compiler doesn't know it (can't forward-declare inheritance)
00104    ElementImpTypeT& Imp() { return static_cast<ElementImpTypeT&>(ImpBase()); }
00105    const ElementImpTypeT& Imp() const { return static_cast<const ElementImpTypeT&>(ImpBase()); }
00106 };
00107 
00108 
00109 
00111 // Array - mimics std::list<Element>, the array contents are
00112 // effectively heterogeneous thanks to the Element base class
00113 
00114 class ArrayImp;
00115 
00132 class Array : public Element_T<ArrayImp>
00133 {
00134 public:
00135    typedef std::list<Element> Members; // map faster, but does not preserve order
00136    typedef Members::iterator iterator;
00137    typedef Members::const_iterator const_iterator;
00138 
00139    Array(); // necessary, or we get linker errors... ?
00140 
00141    iterator Begin();
00142    iterator End();
00143    const_iterator Begin() const;
00144    const_iterator End() const;
00145 
00146    size_t Size() const;  // This is the number of elements in the array.
00147    bool Empty() const;
00148 
00149    const std::string& Dimension() const;  // This is the dimension read in from the file.
00150    void SetDimension(const std::string& sDimension);
00151 
00152    iterator Find(const std::string& name);
00153    const_iterator Find(const std::string& name) const;
00154 
00155    iterator Insert(const Element& element);
00156    iterator Insert(const Element& element, iterator itWhere);
00157    iterator Erase(iterator itWhere);
00158 
00159    Element& operator [] (const std::string& name);
00160    const Element& operator [] (const std::string& name) const;
00161 
00162    void Clear();
00163 };
